articles.author: Evelyn Cheng
articles.title: Fitch upgrades its China growth forecast for 2021 - CNBC
articles.description: Fitch Ratings raised its forecast for China's economic growth next year based on increased domestic demand and expectations of coronavirus vaccine deployment.
articles.content:
BEIJING Fitch Ratings raised its forecast this week for China's economic growth next year, based on increased domestic demand and expectations for coronavirus vaccine deployment.

articles.title: By the Numbers: Rich countries hoard COVID-19 vaccines; global poor to miss out - ABC News
articles.description: Poor countries could only vaccinate 10% of their populations in 2021, while rich countries could vaccinate their whole populations 3 times over, study says.

articles.author: Seema Mody
articles.title: Dry ice sales booming as hospitals get ready to store Pfizer's Covid vaccine at minus 94 degrees - CNBC
articles.description: "Our inventory is a little shot. We've ramped up double our normal volume at this point," Chris Vida, owner of Dry Ice Depot, told CNBC.
articles.content: The ultra-cold temperatures required for storing the Covid-19 vaccine developed by U.S. pharmaceutical giant Pfizer and Germany-based BioNTech has driven a buying frenzy for freezers and dry ice. How… [+5223 chars]

articles.author: Mary Kekatos Senior, Associated
articles.title: Coronavirus: Canada second country to approve Pfizer Covid vaccine - Daily Mail
articles.description: On Wednesday, Health Canada approved the coronavirus vaccine made by Pfizer Inc and its German partner BioNTech SE and is set to receive 249,000 doses of the jab this month.
articles.content:
Canada has become just the second country in the world to approve Pfizer Inc's coronavirus vaccine, and may start immunizing residents as early as next week.
